BUILDING BLOCK - Entity

DescriptionAbstract Concept
An  Entity is an elementary constituent of a model. It is the top level abstraction of HOPEX upper ontology.
Partition - Entity Syntax: an Entity is either an Aggregate Entity Member, a Building Block or a Container Package
Partition - Entity Classification: an Entity is either an Individual or a Class
References:
ISO 15926 - Thing
OMG - KerML - Element
OMG - SBVR - Thing
OMG - UML - Element
VersionAvailable since: HOPEX V2
Last Update: HOPEX V2
Definition Domain  Elementary Graph
The Elementary Graph domain defines the top level constructs employed to formalize entities (Entity) and their Relationships. This comprises the formalization of elementary entities (Entity), their elementary relationship (Nested Entity, Referenced Element) and their classification (Class).
Dictionary  Dictionary of HOPEX patterns
Conceptualization Level  Elementary Graph
